segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, stretching to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks so determined to get those cookies, it's almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the stool is wobbly and about to tip over, but he doesn't seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the girl is waiting for her turn, looking up at him with such expectation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why they don't just ask the woman for some cookies, it would be so much easier.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman is still drying dishes, completely unaware of the children's actions.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit amused watching the boy balance like that, it's quite a sight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing from the sink, adding to the chaos in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really turn around and see what's going on, but she's so absorbed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn't fall and hurt himself, but he seems to be doing okay for now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the girl will try to help him or just keep waiting for her cookie, she seems patient.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the outside through the window, looking so calm and tidy compared to the inside, it's quite a contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR
